intro: Relhania pungens subsp. trinervis, commonly known as the Trinerved Relhania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically divided into three main lobes. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color. This subspecies is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
